chapter.title: Chapter VIII
chapter.subtitle: Akshara Brahma Yoga
chapter.description: Akshara Brahma Yoga is taught in the eighth chapter. In this chapter, Lord Krishna explains to Arjuna the importance of knowledge of Brahman and remembrance of God at the time of death and shows the path of liberation through various yogas.

dedication.meaning: I serve the lotus feet of the fearless one, who gives joy to the devotees

verses.Language:
King Tad Brahma Kimdhyatmang King Karma Purushottam.
Adhibhutang Ch King Proktamdhidaibong Kimuchyate..1..
verses.translation: Arjuna asked - O Purushottam! What is Brahman? What is spirit? What is action? Adhibhuta and Adhidaivai or who is called? Please clarify me.
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Adhyajna: Kathang Kohtra Dehehsminmadhusudan.
Prayankale cha kathang jneyohasi niyatatmavih..2..
verses.translation: O Madhusudan! Who is Adhyajna in this body, and how is he located in this body? How can the Jitendriya people know you at the time of death?
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Aksharang Brahma Paramang Svabhabodhyatmamuchya.
3.
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said - The imperishable being is called Brahman and its eternal nature is called Adhyatma. Karma is the origin and growth of demons.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Adhibhutang ksaro bhava: Purushchadhidaivatam.
Adhyajnohahmevatra dehe dehbhritang bar..4..
verses.translation: Oh the best of body! Possessed of mortal incorporeal nature. The great man who is the sum total of all the sun, moon and primordial gods is called Adhidaiva. And I am the adhyajna in the form of the inner body of the body.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Antakale Cha Mameva Smaranmukta Kalevaram.
Yah prayati sa madbhabang jati nastyatra samshayah..5..
verses.translation: At the time of death he who leaves the body remembering me immediately attains my consciousness. There is no doubt about this.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Jang Jang Bapi Smaran Bhavang Tyajatyante Kalevaram.
Tang tameveiti kaunteya sada tadbhavabhavit:..6..
verses.translation: At the last moment, he who remembers the thought and leaves the body, attains the thought of that thought.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Tasmat Sarveshu Kaleshu Mamanushmar Yudhya f.
7.
verses.translation: Therefore, O Arjuna! Always remember Me and fight with your nature, then your mind and intellect will be entrusted to Me and you will surely gain Me.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Chetsa Nanyagamina is habitual.
8.
verses.translation: O Parth! One who thinks of the Supreme Personality of Godhead with a single-minded mind engaged in Abhyasa Yoga, will surely attain Him.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Kabing Puranamanushasitarmanoraniyangsamanusmared Jah.
Sarvasya dhataramachintyarupamadityavaranga tamasah parastat..9..
verses.translation: One should meditate on the Supreme Lord as Omniscient, Sanatana, Niyanta, subtler than subtle, Lord of all, beyond the material intellect, achinta and Purusha. He is as celestial as the sun and is beyond this material nature.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
At the time of his death, Chaiva added that he was devoted to devotion.
10.
verses.translation: One who at the time of death remembers the Supreme Lord with an unwavering mind, with devotion, with full yogic energy placing the prana-vayu in the bhryugal, he surely attains the divine Supreme Purusha.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yadaksharang vedavido vdanti vishanti yad jatayo vitragah.
11.
verses.translation: I will briefly tell you about what the Vedic pundits call 'Akshara', into which monks without attachment enter, celibate celibates for the sake of gain.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Sarvadvarani Sanyamya Mano Hridi Nirudhya f.
Murdhanyadhayatman: pranamasthito yogadharanam..12..
verses.translation: One has to settle in yoga by restraining all the gates of the senses, restraining the mind in the heart and placing the prana in the brow.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Om ityekaksharang brahma vyaharan mamanusmaran.
13.
verses.translation: If one abandons the body remembering the Supreme Lord while chanting the holy Onkas engaged in yoga practice, he will surely attain supreme speed.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Ananyacheta: satatang yo mang smrati nityashah.
Tasyahang Sulva: Partha Nityayuksya Yogin: 14.
verses.translation: O Parth! I am accessible to the constant bhakta-yogi who single-mindedly remembers only Me.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Mamupetya reincarnation Dukhalayamshasvatam.
Napnubanti Mahatmano Sansiddhing Parmang Gata:
verses.translation: Mahatma, devotional yogis attain Me and are not reborn in this miserable mortal world, because they have attained the Supreme Siddhi.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Abrahambhuvanalloka: Punaravartinoharjuna.
Mamupetya tu kaunteya reincarnation na vidyate..16..
verses.translation: O Arjuna! All people from this world to Brahmaloka are re-born. But O Kaunteya! There is no rebirth when I am attained.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Mahrad Brahmin scholars up to the millennium.
Ratring Yuga Sahasrantang Tehoratrabido Jana: 17.
verses.translation: Brahma has one day in a thousand and four yugas of human quality and one night in a thousand and four yugas. Those who know like this, are day and night guardians.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Abyaktad Vyaktaya: Sarva: Prabhavantyahragame.
18.
verses.translation: At the gathering of the day of Brahma all living beings are manifested from the unmanifest and at the coming of the night of Brahma it again attains the form of the unmanifest.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Bhutgram: Sa ebayang Bhutva Bhutva Praliyate.
19
verses.translation: O Parth! Those ghosts are born again and again in Brahma's nocturnal assembly and again appear on their own at the coming of day.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Paras tasmat tu bhabohanyaঽvyaktoঽvykat Sanatan:.
Yah sa sarveshu bhuteshu nasyatsu na bansyati..20..
verses.translation: But there is another unmanifest nature, which is eternal and beyond manifest and unmanifest objects. Even if all ghosts are destroyed, they are not destroyed.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Abyaktokshar ityastu tamahu: paramang gatim.
Jang prapya na nivrante taddham paramang mam..21..
verses.translation: That inexpressible is called Akshara, hence the ultimate motion of all beings. When one goes there, he does not have to come back to this world. That is my absolute abode.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Purusha: Sa Para: Partha Bhaktya Lavyastvananya.
Yasyantathasthani Bhutani as if Sarvamidang tatam.. 22..
verses.translation: O Parth! The Supreme Lord can be attained only through Ananya Bhakti. He, though eternally present in His abode, is all-pervading and everything resides in Him.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Chaiva Yogin:
Prayata Janti Tang Kalang Bakshyami Bharatarshabha..23..
verses.translation: O Bharat Shrestha! I will tell you about the time when the Yogis return to this world or do not return after death.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Agnirjyotirah: Shukla: Shanmasa Uttarayanam.
Tatra Prayata Gachchanti Brahma Brahmabido Janah..24..
verses.translation: Brahmavit men attain Brahman by relinquishing their bodies during Agni, Jyoti, Shubhdin, Shuklapaksha and six months of Uttarayana.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Dhumo Ratristatha Krishna: Shanmasa Dakshinayanam.
Tatra Chandramsong Jyotigargamyat Repeat: 25.
verses.translation: After leaving the body during the six months of Dhum, Ratri, Krishna Paksha or Dakshinayana, the yogi returns to the mortal world after traveling to Chandraloka and enjoying the pleasures.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Sukrakrishna Gati Hyete Jagat: According to the Eternal.
26.
verses.translation: According to Vedic there are two ways of leaving this world - one is Shula and the other is Krishna. If he leaves his body on Shuklamarga he does not have to come back, but if he leaves his body on Krishnamarga he has to return.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Naite Sriti Partha Janan Yogi Muhyati Kaschan.
27.
verses.translation: O Parth! Devotees aware of these two paths never become disillusioned. So O Arjuna! You practice Bhakti Yoga.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Bedushu Yajneshu Tapashu Chaiva Daneshu Yat Punyaphalang Pradistam.
Atyeti tat sarvamidang viditva yogi parang sthanamupaiti chadyam..28..
verses.translation: If you practice Bhakti Yoga you will not be deprived of any result. Veda readings, sacrifices, penances, donations, all kinds of knowledge and actions, the fruits of that community, you get the original and supreme abode through devotional yoga.
verses.speaker: the supreme
